contextId.information: Here the bitter water is described as being able to bring a curse. This means that when the woman drinks the water it cause her to be unable to bear children, if she is guilty. AT: "this bitter water can be a curse to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: this bitter water that can bring a curse

contextId.information: The group of Levites carrying the ark of the covenant went before the people of Israel as the traveled. AT: "Men carried the ark of the covenant of Yahweh before them as they traveled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The ark of the covenant of Yahweh went before them

contextId.information: Here the ark is spoken of as if were a person traveling. The ark was really being carried by men. AT: "Whenever the people carrying the ark set out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

Moses speaks of sin as if it were a person who will condemn the guilty person. This means that the people cannot escape the punishment that their sin deserves. AT: "Know for sure that Yahweh will punish you for your sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: Be sure that your sin will find you out
